abstract: Our Friday morning roundup of technology news also looks at 3-D movies and televisions and the poor sales at Palm.
snippet: Our Friday morning roundup of technology news also looks at 3-D movies and televisions and the poor sales at Palm.
lead_paragraph: Facebook Granted Patent on the News FeedAs we noted Thursday, Facebook has been granted a patent for the its central feature, the news feed. ReadWriteWeb spotlights the discussion in the blogosphere on the topic, with many questioning if Facebook actually invented the algorithm-driven newsfeed. Bloggers also ask if the company will enforce its patent against other services, including Google Reader and Google Buzz, or if the move is just defensive.

headline.main: Bits Scan: Facebook’s Patent, Nokia’s Woes and Phishing on Twitter

abstract: Amazon.com is pushing newspaper, magazine and book publishers to guarantee that Kindle customers will get the lowest prices on electronic content. In return, publishers may get a bigger cut of the revenue.
snippet: Amazon.com is pushing newspaper, magazine and book publishers to guarantee that Kindle customers will get the lowest prices on electronic content. In return, publishers may get a bigger cut of the revenue.
lead_paragraph: On Jan. 27, Steven P. Jobs was still standing on a stage in San Francisco, presenting Apple’s new iPad, when the phones started ringing. Senior managers from Amazon.com were calling newspaper, magazine and book publishers trying to glean any information possible about the deals Apple was offering them to supply content for its new reading device.

headline.main: When It Comes to Content, Amazon’s Kindle Won’t Be Undersold

abstract: The Associated Press will create paid subscriptions through the Apple iPad for itself and other news organizations.
snippet: The Associated Press will create paid subscriptions through the Apple iPad for itself and other news organizations.
lead_paragraph: The Associated Press will create paid subscriptions through the Apple iPad for itself and other news organizations, the company’s leader said Friday, in the latest step of its campaign for the battered news business to control and profit from the electronic use of its work.

headline.main: Associated Press to Create Pay Service for iPad
